message.content:
I realized I missed `PaidMedia.de_json` which acts as a factory to create the correct subclass.
Also I need to handle imports carefully to avoid circular dependencies if any.

I'll update `telegram/_paidmedia.py` to include `de_json` in `PaidMedia` class that dispatches to subclasses.

function.name: str_replace_editor

extras.old_content:
def __init__(
        self,
        type: str,
        *,
        api_kwargs: Optional[JSONDict] = None,
    ):
        super().__init__(api_kwargs=api_kwargs)
        self.type: str = type
extras.diff:
--- /workspace/python-telegram-bot__python-telegram-bot__546207528428803/telegram/_paidmedia.py
+++ /workspace/python-telegram-bot__python-telegram-bot__546207528428803/telegram/_paidmedia.py
@@ -57,0 +58,26 @@
+    @classmethod
+    def de_json(
+        cls, data: Optional[JSONDict], bot: Optional["Bot"] = None  # type: ignore[name-defined]
+    ) -> Optional["PaidMedia"]:
+        """See :meth:`telegram.TelegramObject.de_json`."""
+        if not data:
+            return None
+
+        if "width" in data and "duration" in data:
+            return PaidMediaPreview.de_json(data, bot)
+        if "photo" in data:
+            return PaidMediaPhoto.de_json(data, bot)
+        if "video" in data:
+            return PaidMediaVideo.de_json(data, bot)
+
+        # Fallback if type is present but we didn't match specific fields, though type check is safer
+        if "type" in data:
+            if data["type"] == "preview":
+                return PaidMediaPreview.de_json(data, bot)
+            if data["type"] == "photo":
+                return PaidMediaPhoto.de_json(data, bot)
+            if data["type"] == "video":
+                return PaidMediaVideo.de_json(data, bot)
+
+        return super().de_json(data, bot)
+
